article.heading: Names
article.paragraph: As was the custom, his personal name and the name after assuming the title Khagan were different. His personal name was : , Ashn mjlin, a-shih-na mo-chi-lan) . His name after assuming the title was Bilge Khagan (or Bilge Qhagan). "Bilge" meaning "wise" or "one who has wisdom" in Turkic languages. Khagan (Kaan) is a title for ruler (like king, earl, etc.). "Bilge", as is the case with many pure Turkic names, is a unisex name. Even in today's Turkey, Bilge continues to be adopted both as a male and female name. Kaan or Kaan, however, is used only as a male name in contemporary Turkish.
article.heading: As a khagan
article.paragraph: In 716,Kapaghan Khaganthe second khaghan of the khaganate was killed in his campaign againstTokuz-OguzesToquz Oghuzand his severed head was sent toChang'an.Old Book of Tang,:zh:s:/194Vol. 194-IAlthough his sonInel Qaghansucceeded him, the legal claimant of the throne was his cousin Ashn mjlin. Mojilan's brotherKul TiginandTonyukukcarried out acoup d'tatagainst Inel Qaghan. They killed Inel Qaghan and made Mojilan a khagan with the name Bilge Qaghan.His name literally means "wise king".

Bilge's khaganate spanned vast steppes from theCaspian SeatoManchuria; he also invaded the western sections of theChinaChineseterritories. After his death from poisoning, severalstelaewere erected inOrkhon Valleythe capital areaby theOrkhon River. TheseOrkhon inscriptionsare the first known texts in theOld Turkic language.He was poisoned by Buyruk ChorErkin Ekrem, "Sar Uygurlarn Kkeni", ''Modern Trklk Aratrma Dergisi'', Vol. 4, No. 3, 2007, p. 175.(/, mil chu, mei-lu-ch'o). He didn't die immediately and he had time to punish the family of Buyruk Chor with death.
